segments.text: I notice the boy on the stool, and I feel a little sad for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: He’s so determined to get those cookies, but he’s going to fall.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is watching him, and I wonder if she’s ever worried about him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely unaware, and it makes me feel lonely for the kids.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water overflowing, and it feels like no one cares about the mess.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene feels like a metaphor for neglect.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the children feel ignored or if they’re just being mischievous.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy’s struggle to reach the jar makes me feel for him.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope they get what they want, but I also hope they don’t get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The scene is full of little tragedies waiting to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR
